required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cultivation of Hyalocytes From ILM and ERM Samples: a Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Cultivation of Hyalocytes From ILM and ERM Samples: a Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

clinical_study.source: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: ILM and ERM are routinely excised during surgery, as part of the surgical technique, and cultivation of hyalocytes will be performed ex vivo after surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Hyalocytes, typically located 20 to 50Î¼m anterior the internal limiting membrane (ILM), have the potential to contribute to development of epiretinal membranes (ERM) in presence of vitreoschisis. For macular holes, hyalocytes located on the ILM are hypothesized to contribute to the closure of the macular hole after application of the inverted ILM flap technique.
ILM is routinely excised during surgical repair of macular holes. During peeling of ERM it is excised in case of persisting wrinkling of the retinal surface or partial en bloc excision with the ERM. Furthermore, excision of ILM during ERM peeling is associated with significantly lower recurrence rates of ERM and better Long term visual acuity, according to the results reported by Chang et al. Removal of ERM and ILM is part of the surgical routine during surgical repair of macular holes and peeling of epiretinal membranes. Therefore, cultivation of excised ERM and ILM samples does not increase risks for patients in any way. During study it is planned to cultivate hyalocytes for investigation of their role in macular hole closure.

primary_outcome.description: hyalocytes from ERM and ILM will be cultured and counted

arm_group.description: Hyalocytes from ERM and ILM are cultured in alphaMEM to examine their proliferation habits

intervention.description: ERM and ILM are peeled routinely during surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Macular hole or epiretinal Membrane
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy (pregnancy test will be taken preoperatively in women of reproductive age)

reference.citation: Chang WC, Lin C, Lee CH, Sung TL, Tung TH, Liu JH. Vitrectomy with or without internal limiting membrane peeling for idiopathic epiretinal membrane: A meta-analysis. PLoS One. 2017 Jun 16;12(6):e0179105. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0179105. eCollection 2017. Review.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery
responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Prim. Prof. Dr. Oliver Findl, MBA
